title: True of budget given income and spending figures

content.question: Suppose the only revenue taken in by the government is in the form of income taxes and the tax rate is <math alttext="10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>10</mtext></math> percent. If national income is <math alttext="$900" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$900</mtext></math> billion and government expenditures plus transfers are <math alttext="$120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$120</mtext></math> billion, which of the following is true about the government budget?

choices.label: The government budget has a surplus of <math alttext="$780" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$780</mtext></math> billion.
The government budget has a surplus of <math alttext="$120" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$120</mtext></math> billion.
The government budget has a deficit of <math alttext="$90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$90</mtext></math> billion.
The government budget has a deficit of <math alttext="$30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$30</mtext></math> billion.

content.answer: The government budget has a deficit of <math alttext="$30" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$30</mtext></math> billion.
